mbthemes 0.0.1

Modified ggplot2 objects for Mel B. Labs blog posts

Source: R/theme.R
gglabs.Rd

Convenience function to generate ggplot2 plots with custom element sizes, color scales and guides matching active branding (per _brand.yml).

Usage

gglabs(
  data = NULL,
  mapping = aes(),
  pos_x = c("bottom", "top"),
  pos_y = c("right", "left"),
  ...
)

Arguments

data

Default dataset to use for plot. If not already a data.frame, will be converted to one by fortify(). If not specified, must be supplied in each layer added to the plot.

mapping

Default list of aesthetic mappings to use for plot. If not specified, must be supplied in each layer added to the plot.

pos_x

Position of x-axis (bottom or top)

pos_y

Position of y-axis (right or left)

...

Arguments passed on to theme_labs

base_bg

Plot, panel, legend background

base_color

Color for text and line elements

base_size

base font size, given in pts.

base_family

base font family

Value

A ggplot2 object with new theme elements applied

Examples

require(ggplot2)
#> Loading required package: ggplot2

gglabs(mtcars, aes(factor(carb), mpg, fill=factor(carb))) + 
  geom_col() +
  guides(y=guide_none(), y.sec=guide_axis()) +
  labs(
    x = "carb",
    title = "My Long and Descriptive Plot Title",
    subtitle = "My very long subtitle with many units",
    caption = "My very long plot caption with many references.")
#> Error in geom_col(): Problem while computing aesthetics.
#> ℹ Error occurred in the 1st layer.
#> Caused by error:
#> ! object 'labs.colors' not found

gglabs(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +
  geom_smooth(color=pal("red"), fill=pal("pink")) +
  geom_point(size=3, aes(color=carb)) +
  labs(
  title = "My Title",
  subtitle = "My Subtitle",
  caption = "My plot caption")
#> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'
#> Warning: font family 'Roboto Condensed' not found in PostScript font database

gglabs(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color=factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(size=3) + 
  labs(
  x = "cyl",
  title = "My Title",
  subtitle = "My Subtitle",
  caption = "My plot caption")
#> Error in geom_point(size = 3): Problem while computing aesthetics.
#> ℹ Error occurred in the 1st layer.
#> Caused by error:
#> ! object 'labs.colors' not found
